args:
In the depths of the facility, Phares begins his
experiment. Beren pours mana from the kiln
into a dragon, producing a void version of
Poseidon. But Leif suddenly appears to help
the heroes, and together they face off against
their massive foe.
Is this the facility's innermost chamber?
The hell is this creepy stuff?\nIt ain't water, I know that much.
I feel drawn to it. Could it be the artificial\nmana you mentioned earlier, Cleo?
Mana is by its nature formless, invisible,\nand inviolable. And yet...
Perhaps it was put into this form to make\nit easier to manage? But that would take\nunimaginably advanced technology...
Well, whatever they're doin', it's terrible.\nNo wonder the lake and forest around\nhere are all deadâ€”they took the mana!
Dude, look! Over there!\nIt's little creep and big creep!

You stand before a mana kiln, a device
wrought from ancient wisdom that permits
the harvesting and subsequent physical
utilization of mana.
And this place would appear to be\na testing facility for early models\nof said kiln.
It is a place with a massive accumulation\nof mana...and it is the perfect location\nfor my experiment.
Nnngh... What is this intense wind?!
The hell is this kid doin'?!
All the mana was swallowed up!
This miasma is unbelievable...\nI cannot see a thing!
The heck's happening to his body?!
Beren's preparations are complete.\nNow for the next step...
Noâ€”that roar came from a dragon that\nstill has self-awareness. But it is filled\nwith a terrible fury.
Is this the guardian dragon of Lake Reeve?
Cleverer than I thought, my brother!\nThis is indeed the water dragon that\noversees the mana of the lake.
I thought it strange that we did not see\na dragon at the lake. You captured it?!
More accurate to say that a dragon that\nwas ordered to be captured alive by the\nEmpress was given to me.
So you got it from Morsayati? Phares,\nwhy are you following the Other?!
I care not who aids my research,\nso long as it is aided.
The objectives of the Empress and myself\nare one and the same.
The black mana has claimed it...
The child is responsible for the\nproduction of void dragons.
Then you're the one who sent the\nvoid dragons after us, aren't you?
I wondered when you might realize this.
No wonder the dragons kept rushin' us\nthe moment we ran into ya.
Now then, I wonder how much power\nthis new dragon truly has?

Thankfully, we have a suitable opponent
on which to test it conveniently located
right before us. I do hope I can count on
your prompt cooperation in this matter.
S-stop... Why are you doing this?!
We have no reason to fight!
Brother, is it? Your ignorance is pitiable.
Pray forgive the lateness of my arrival,\nPrince {player_name}.
I'll be all right, Leif, thank you.\nBut what are you DOING here?!
Chelle informed me that Phares was\nplotting some most nefarious deeds.
If you would suffer my personal opinion,\nPrince Phares, I must give itâ€”I fear\nyou err most grievously in your ways.
Your wisdom is meant to bring light to\nAlberia, and I cannot stand by and\npermit you to use it in this fashion.
Heh. You never change, Leifâ€”you always\ndid love preaching about principles.
Ah, well. If you will be joining my brother,\nthat only makes the setting for my grand\nexperiment all the better.
What will be the result of pouring mana far\nbeyond their original levels into a dragon?\nLet us discover the answer together!
Are you done listening to me, Phares?\nIs there nothing I can say?
So be it. In that case, I'll do what I\nmust to stop this dragonâ€”AND you!
Your Highness, take care to be cautious.\nThis creature is a most formidable foe.
I will assist you to the best of my abilities.
Thank you, Leif. Now let's go!
